comments:
Updraged from 3.0M7 to 3.0M9 and set up the worksapce.

I have several projects managed by CVS running on my local machine.  
Beacuse eclipse does not support local cvs connections The connections where set
up as follows,

Tools cvs/sshd setup from cygwin (sources.redhat.com)
cvs init'ed on F:\workarea\cvs (non local, mapped drive so is backedup)
sshd installed to allow connections.

Connection in CVS is :extssh:nordj@localhost:/cygdrive/f/workarea/cvs
(needs the local version of the path which is a cygwin mapping)

This worked fine in m7 but has strage results in m9

when eclipse is first started if i switch to CVS Repository view and expand the
HEAD then the modules in CVS are shown.
If I try to expand any of the modules they are all empty
If I then refresh by right clicking on
:extssh:nordj@localhost:/cygdrive/f/workarea/cvs and choosing refresh view all
modules disapear from HEAD.

output in the log is,
!SESSION May 24, 2004 18:36:41.871 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I200405211200
java.version=1.4.2_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_GB
!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui 4 0 May 24, 2004 18:36:41.871
!MESSAGE Internal error
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSException: The server reported an error
while performing the "cvs checkout" command.
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSRepositoryLocation.members(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:701)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.repo.RepositoryRoot.getDefinedModulesCache(RepositoryRoot.java:98)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.repo.RepositoryRoot.getDefinedModules(RepositoryRoot.java:113)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.FetchMembersOperation.execute(FetchMembersOperation.java:110)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.CVSOperation.run(CVSOperation.java:84)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.model.CVSTagElement.fetchDeferredChildren(CVSTagElement.java:132)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.progress.DeferredTreeContentManager$1.run(DeferredTreeContentManager.java:152)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 -10 May 24, 2004 18:36:41.871
!MESSAGE The server reported an error while performing the "cvs checkout" command.
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 -14 May 24, 2004 18:36:41.871
!MESSAGE : cvs server: cannot open /cygdrive/f/workarea/cvs/CVSROOT/config:
Permission denied
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 -14 May 24, 2004 18:36:41.871
!MESSAGE : cvs [server aborted]: failed to open the modules file


permissions are correct, I can ssh into the box and cat the files.
The same config works on m7
the ssh server accepts both ssh1 and ssh2 client versions.
I have another repository on a Linux box with ssh connection and that works on
both m7 & m9
I can setup a new cvs repository on my machine on a local drive without
probelems (m7 & m9)
If i set up a new cvs repository on my machine with a remote drive mapping then
it works on M7 but not m9


Steps to reproduce.
Install cygwin sshd and cvs from sources.redhat.com
mount a drive that is shared from another windows box.
ssh into you box and navigate to the mounted drive.
mkdir /cygdrive/<letter of mapped drive>/cvs_test
cvs -d /cygdrive/<letter of mapped drive>/cvs_test

start eclipse m7
create a new CVS repository with extssh:localhost:/cygdrive/<letter of mapped
drive>/cvs_test
verify the connection works by checking the contents of CVSROOT

start m9
create a new CVS repository with extssh:localhost:/cygdrive/<letter of mapped
drive>/cvs_test
verify the connection doesn't work by checking the lack of contents of CVSROOT
To narrow down the window of change I checked this on M8 and it worked.
This is probably a duplicate of bug 63751
*** Bug 63751 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

From bug 63751, the problem appears to be an invcompatibility between SSH2 in 
Eclipse and SSH2 in cygwin. Potential (but untested workarounds are mentioned 
in bug 63751).

Is it true that there is an invcompatibility between SSH2 in Eclipse and SSH2
in cygwin?  It seems that error messages are from remote cvs command
and that means 'cvs server' has been successfully execed on ssh2 session.

May I ask you to try OpenSSH's ssh2 client on your Win2K box?
I mean that, for example,
  export CVS_RSH=ssh
  cvs -d :ext:nordj@localhost:/cygdrive/f/workarea/cvs checkout module

Re comment 5

C:\new\test>cvs -d :ext:nordj@localhost:/cygdrive/f/workarea/cvs co CVSROOT
nordj@localhost's password:
cvs server: Updating CVSROOT
U CVSROOT/checkoutlist
U CVSROOT/commitinfo
U CVSROOT/config
U CVSROOT/cvswrappers
U CVSROOT/editinfo
U CVSROOT/loginfo
U CVSROOT/modules
U CVSROOT/notify
U CVSROOT/rcsinfo
U CVSROOT/taginfo
U CVSROOT/verifymsg

C:\new\test>echo %CVS_RSH%
ssh

C:\new\test>which ssh
/usr/bin/ssh

There is something strange with m9.

You can disable ssh2 support in sshd but then eclipse gets an IO Error
ie it doesn't gracefully fallback to ssh1
tested with PuTTY/ssh and both fallback

Note that is a different problem to the one I reported (and the duplicate).

The server works with standalone cygwin cvs/ssh and with m7 eclipse integrated stuff

CYGWIN_NT-5.0 1.5.6
Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.11.6 (client/server)
sshd version OpenSSH_3.7.1p2

|You can disable ssh2 support in sshd but then eclipse gets an IO Error
 |ie it doesn't gracefully fallback to ssh1
I'm sorry for continuing such an offtopic thing, but
I could also reproduce this fallback problem and I have found this is
from my fault.  If you are interested in ssh1 connection,
download 'http://www.jcraft.com/jsch/jsch-0.1.16-rc1.jar' and save it
as 'plugins/org.eclipse.team.cvs.ssh2_3.0.0/jsch-0.1.15.jar'.
Moving the bug over to you ymnk.
Have you released this fix into the 0.1.16 jsch jar in Eclipse?

That jsch-0.1.16.jar has fixed the followig problem,
 |You can disable ssh2 support in sshd but then eclipse gets an IO Error
 |ie it doesn't gracefully fallback to ssh1
but I have not understood yet why James Nord has encountered 
'Permission denied' message.  I can not guess that problem has been 
caused by the protocol incompatibility.

I can't see it being a protocol error either as it works if the files are on a
local drive.

I will all the same download the newer version and test.

Installed the newer version and I still get the same problems.

Disabled SSH2 support in sshd and it works, so this seems like a protocol error :-/

There is a pure java terminal emulator based on jsch(, which
is the core of SSH2 support in Eclise 3.0) and it is available
at http://www.wiredx.net/jcterm/ on demand.
Can you login to your cygwin sshd by that emulator and
get access to '/cygdrive/f/workarea/cvs/CVSROOT/config' file?

I can read the files with JCTerm.  (cat, less, vim)

note I cannot write to them (perm is read-only ugo=r), but this is the same for
an ssh1 client and a local bash session.

Thank you for feedback.
That JCTerm has used jsch-0.1.16 and it is also included in
Eclipse 3.0M9,RC1.
I guess you had used password authentication on JCTerm.
What authentication had you tried on Eclipse 3.0M9?
If you had tried the public-key authentication on M9,
how about the content of your remote 'authorized_keys' file?
Are there any options for your public-key?

I use/ have used only password authentication.

Can this really be a authentication issue?  on first connect the modules are
found correctly, but all subsequent access fails.

Moving post 3.0, we don't have time to investigate now. Yamanaka can you
continue to follow this one. Thanks.

This bug has not seen any activity in 2 years and we have not had other reports of similar failures. If you are still experiencing the failure, please reopen with the the steps to reprodice on a ecent Eclipse build (preferably 3.2).

Our usual practice is to move bugs to the RESOLVED REMIND state when there is not enough information provided to address the reported issue and more information has been requested. This bug has been in the RESOLVED REMIND state for quite some time so it is being CLOSED. If you can provide the requested information or you otherwise feel that this is still an issue, please reopen the bug. If you are unable to open it due to a lack or permissions, please add a comment to the bug stating that you would like to have the request reconsidered.  I applogize for this blanket approach to bug screening but there are just to many bugs in the REMIND state for us to effectively triage them. Your help in this matter is appreciated.
